All Classes

  • Class Description
    ColorKeyframe
    The ColorKeyframe class allows you to specify how the colors of particles should change over time.
    Compressor
    A collection of methods for compression and saving data
    CustomParticleBehavior
    Use this interface to create your own custom particle behaviors outside of those provided
    CustomParticleDraw
    CustomParticleDraw is a way to define your own custom ways of drawing your particles based on an x and y coordinate, and the life of the particles (life is in frames) This is to be applied to a ParticleDrawable
    CustomParticleInteracion
    Use this interface to create custom interactions between particles outside of those provided
    GenerationType
    A GenerationType dictates how particles will be created
    HeavyCache Deprecated.
    InitialBehavior
    InitialBehavior is used to describe how the particles will behave Upon spawning.
    InvalidJSONException
    InvalidJSONException is thrown when the JSON used to initiate an engine or keyframe is incorrectly formatted
    LightCache
    The LightCache class is used to create faster caches based on particle engines.
    Particle
    The particle class is used internally and doesn't need to be referenced unless you are creating custom behaviors or interactions.
    ParticleBehavior
    Descriptors for different types of particle behavior.
    ParticleDrawable
    A wrapper to define how particles of a given engine will be drawn.
    ParticleEngine
    The ParticleEngine class wraps together ParticleDrawable, Particle, and applies many properties.
    ParticleEngineFactory
    A way to get quick access to simpler engines without too much setup.
    ParticleInteraction
    ParticleInteraction dictates how particles will interact with their environment and each other.
    ParticleLifeEffect
    Particle Life effects are visual effects that change the color of particles
    ParticleRunner
    The interface ParticleRunner allows you to switch easily between Engines and Caches.
    Shape
